attributes.action: Allow Skilled Worker sponsorship for graduate visa holders in entry-level roles
attributes.additional_details: International graduates have followed all UK immigration rules, paid high university fees, and now work in vital entry-level roles like NHS admin and care. But the £38,700 salary threshold blocks us from being sponsored. We ask for a fairer visa pathway that reflects real job salaries and allows us to stay, grow, and contribute to the UK — the country we've invested in and come to call home.  Expecting new graduates to secure high-salary roles straight away is unrealistic and unfair.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to allow Skilled Worker visa sponsorship for international graduates already in the UK who are working or seeking work in entry-level roles, particularly in sectors in NHS Expecting graduates to secure high salary roles is unrealistic and unfair.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. There are already different salary rules for recent graduates who wish to be sponsored for a Skilled Worker visa, and there is also a lower minimum salary for some healthcare jobs. 

More information on reduced salary requirements for the Skilled Worker visa can be found here, including the requirements that must be met: https://www.gov.uk/skilled-worker-visa/when-you-can-be-paid-less

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
